abstract: The commercial director at Next Media Limited said HSBC and Standard Chartered ended advertising after being told to do so by the Chinese government.
snippet: The commercial director at Next Media Limited said HSBC and Standard Chartered ended advertising after being told to do so by the Chinese government.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — In what may be a major escalation of pressure by mainland China on Hong Kong’s independent-minded news media, two major British banks have stopped advertising with one of the city’s biggest newspapers, a top media executive said.

headline.main: Hong Kong Media Worries Over China’s Reach as Ads Disappear
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Media Worries Over China’s Reach as Ads Vanish

byline.original: By Michael Forsythe and Neil Gough
